summary: Completed comprehensive testing of updated subscription tiers (5 tiers: Free/Starter/Pro/Premium/Elite). All 27 backend API tests passed (100%). Frontend UI testing confirmed all subscription features working correctly including 5-tier grid layout, billing toggle, current plan badge, proposal usage tracking, 'Most Popular' badge on Pro, and 'Contact Us' button for Elite.
passed_tests: GET /api/subscriptions/plans returns all 8 plans (free, starter_monthly, starter_annual, pro_monthly, pro_annual, premium_monthly, premium_annual, elite)
Plans endpoint is public (no auth required)
Free plan: $0, 3 proposals, no ARRIS insights, community support
Starter Monthly: $9.99/month, 10 proposals, ARRIS insights enabled, email support
Starter Annual: $99.99/year with $19.89 savings, $8.33/mo equivalent
Pro Monthly: $29.99/month, 25 proposals, priority review, advanced dashboards
Pro Annual: $299.99/year with $59.89 savings, $25.00/mo equivalent
Pro plan has is_popular=true ('Most Popular' badge)
Premium Monthly: $99.99/month, unlimited proposals, API access
Premium Annual: $999.99/year with $199.89 savings, $83.33/mo equivalent
Elite plan: is_custom=true, dedicated support, account manager, SLA guarantee
Elite plan checkout rejected with 'contact us' message
Free plan checkout rejected (no payment needed)
Starter checkout creates Stripe session with $9.99 amount
Pro checkout creates Stripe session with $29.99 amount
Premium checkout creates Stripe session with $99.99 amount
Invalid plan_id rejected with 400 error
GET /api/subscriptions/my-status requires authentication
GET /api/subscriptions/my-status returns subscription info for authenticated creator
GET /api/subscriptions/my-transactions requires authentication
GET /api/subscriptions/my-transactions returns transaction list
Subscription page displays all 5 tier cards (Free, Starter, Pro, Premium, Elite)
Monthly/Annual toggle switches between billing cycles correctly
Annual plans show savings (Starter $19.89, Pro $59.89, Premium $199.89)
Pro plan has 'Most Popular' badge displayed
Elite plan shows 'Contact Us' button instead of checkout
Current Plan banner shows tier and proposals used (7/3 for test creator)
'Current' badge shown on Free plan card for logged-in user
Back to Dashboard button visible on subscription page
seed_data_creation: Test creator (testcreator@example.com) is on Free tier with 7 proposals (over the 3 limit). Multiple checkout sessions created during testing.
context_for_next_testing_agent: Subscription tiers updated from 3 tiers (Free/Pro/Enterprise) to 5 tiers (Free/Starter/Pro/Premium/Elite). API returns 8 plans total (5 tiers with monthly/annual variants for paid tiers). Elite plan has is_custom=true and checkout is rejected with 'contact us' message. Pro plan has is_popular=true for 'Most Popular' badge. Annual savings: Starter $19.89, Pro $59.89, Premium $199.89. Test creator has 7 proposals (over free tier limit of 3). All data-testid attributes are properly set for testing.
